results.byline: By Ashley Southall and Jonah E. Bromwich
results.title: 2 Men Convicted of Killing Malcolm X Will Be Exonerated After Decades
results.abstract: The 1966 convictions of the two men are expected to be thrown out after a lengthy investigation, validating long-held doubts about who killed the civil rights leader.

results.title: House, Mostly Along Party Lines, Censures Gosar for Violent Video
results.abstract: The Arizona Republican is the first member of the House to be formally rebuked in more than a decade. He was also removed from two committees.

results.title: Democrats Shouldn’t Panic. They Should Go Into Shock.
results.abstract: “No administration is going to thrive in that economic environment.”

media.caption: Disappointed supporters of Terry McAuliffe, who lost the governor’s race in Virginia to Glenn Youngkin, a Republican. It may be a while before Democrats have much to cheer about.

results.title: Frida Kahlo Self-Portrait Sells for $34.9 Million
results.abstract: The sale at Sotheby’s on Tuesday was a benchmark for Kahlo and was the most valuable work of Latin American art ever sold at auction.

media.caption: Frida Kahlo’s “Diego and I,” from 1949, sold for $34.9 million at a Sotheby’s auction on Tuesday.

results.title: Jan. 6 Defendant Known as QAnon Shaman Sentenced to 41 Months
results.abstract: Jacob Chansley, who wore a horned helmet and a fur pelt as he stormed onto the Senate floor during the Capitol riot, had earlier pleaded guilty to a single felony count.

media.caption: Jacob Chansley, a former actor and Navy sailor, was one of the first rioters to break into the Capitol on Jan. 6.

results.title: Man Is Spared Prison After Guilty Plea in Sexual Attacks on 4 Teens
results.abstract: The judge who sentenced the man, Christopher Belter, said that he had “agonized” over the decision but that incarceration wasn’t “appropriate.”

media.caption: Christopher Belter in court in 2019. He was sentenced to eight years’ probation after pleading guilty to rape, attempted sexual abuse and two misdemeanors in attacks on four girls.

results.title: Here’s the Secret to the Best Mashed Potatoes for Thanksgiving
results.abstract: You’ve tried boiling, but Genevieve Ko found a better way to make this side dish fluffier — and more flavorful.

media.caption: A final sprinkle of salt — or a ladle of gravy — can add an extra savory note to mashed potatoes.

results.title: Want a Clue About the 2022 Midterm Elections? Look at 2 Ohio Races.
results.abstract: Neither race received much national attention, but there’s a long history of special election results foreshadowing the next general election.

results.title: Taylor Swift’s ‘All Too Well’ and the Weaponization of Memory
results.abstract: The new 10-minute version of a bitter breakup song from 2012 luxuriates in its details and its supersize length, correcting a power imbalance in the relationship it describes.

media.caption: Taylor Swift performed her full 10-minute “All Too Well” on “Saturday Night Live” as the short film she directed for it played behind her.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Frauds and Swindling;Ayvazyan, Richard;Terabelian, Marietta;Ayvazyan, Artur
results.title: A couple convicted of stealing Covid funds is on the run, the F.B.I. says.
results.abstract: Richard Ayvazyan and his wife, Marietta Terabelian, cut their monitoring bracelets and fled in August, the agency said. On Monday, they were sentenced in absentia.

media.caption: Richard Ayvazyan, who was convicted in a scheme to steal $20 million in Covid-19 relief funds, at the federal courthouse in Los Angeles in June.
media.copyright: Gary Coronado/Los Angeles Times, via Getty Images
